Callout.description: Callout that displays information about a selected annotation near the annotation.

props.name: title
props.description: String that get's displayed in the default callout.

props.name: style
props.description: Style property for the Animated.View wrapper, apply animations to this

props.name: containerStyle
props.description: Style property for the native MLRNCallout container, set at your own risk.

props.name: contentStyle
props.description: Style property for the content bubble.

props.name: tipStyle
props.description: Style property for the triangle tip under the content.

props.name: textStyle
props.description: Style property for the title in the content bubble.

Callout.name: Callout

methods.name: fitBounds
methods.description: Map camera transitions to fit provided bounds
examples:
cameraRef.current?.fitBounds([lng, lat], [lng, lat])
cameraRef.current?.fitBounds([lng, lat], [lng, lat], 20, 1000) // padding for all sides
cameraRef.current?.fitBounds([lng, lat], [lng, lat], [verticalPadding, horizontalPadding], 1000)
cameraRef.current?.fitBounds([lng, lat], [lng, lat], [top, right, bottom, left], 1000)

methods.name: flyTo

params.name: coordinates
params.description: Coordinates that map camera will jump to

methods.description: Map camera will fly to new coordinate

methods.name: moveTo

params.name: coordinates
params.description: Coordinates that map camera will move too

methods.description: Map camera will move to new coordinate at the same zoom level
examples:
cameraRef.current?.moveTo([lng, lat], 200) // eases camera to new location based on duration
cameraRef.current?.moveTo([lng, lat]) // snaps camera to new location without any easing

methods.name: zoomTo

params.name: zoomLevel
params.description: Zoom level that the map camera will animate too

methods.description: Map camera will zoom to specified level

methods.name: setCamera
methods.description: Map camera will perform updates based on provided config. Advanced use only!

props.name: centerCoordinate
props.description: The location on which the map should center.

props.name: bounds
props.description:
The corners of a box around which the map should bound. Contains padding props for backwards
compatibility; the root `padding` prop should be used instead.

props.name: heading
props.description: The heading (orientation) of the map.

props.name: pitch
props.description: The pitch of the map.

props.name: zoomLevel
props.description: The zoom level of the map.

props.name: padding
props.description: The viewport padding in points.

props.name: animationDuration
props.description: The duration the map takes to animate to a new configuration.

props.name: animationMode
props.description: The easing or path the camera uses to animate to a new configuration.

props.name: defaultSettings
props.description: Default view settings applied on camera

props.name: minZoomLevel
props.description: Minimum zoom level of the map

props.name: maxZoomLevel
props.description: Maximum zoom level of the map

props.name: maxBounds
props.description: Restrict map panning so that the center is within these bounds

props.name: followUserLocation
props.description: Should the map orientation follow the user's.

props.name: followUserMode
props.description: The mode used to track the user location on the map. One of; "normal", "compass", "course". Each mode string is also available as a member on the `UserTrackingMode` object. `Follow` (normal), `FollowWithHeading` (compass), `FollowWithCourse` (course). NOTE: `followUserLocation` must be set to `true` for any of the modes to take effect.

props.name: followZoomLevel
props.description: The zoomLevel on map while followUserLocation is set to `true`

props.name: followPitch
props.description: The pitch on map while followUserLocation is set to `true`

props.name: followHeading
props.description: The heading on map while followUserLocation is set to `true`

props.name: onUserTrackingModeChange
props.description:
Triggered when `followUserLocation` or `followUserMode` changes
*signature:*`(event:MapLibreRNEvent) => void`

CircleLayer.description: CircleLayer is a style layer that renders one or more filled circles on the map.

props.name: style
props.description: Customizable style attributes

props.name: sourceID
props.description: FIX ME NO DESCRIPTION

CircleLayer.name: CircleLayer

styles.name: circleSortKey
styles.description: Sorts features in ascending order based on this value. Features with a higher sort key will appear above features with a lower sort key.

styles.name: visibility

values.doc: The layer is shown.
The layer is not shown.

styles.description: Whether this layer is displayed.

styles.name: circleRadius
styles.description: Circle radius.

styles.name: circleColor
styles.description: The fill color of the circle.

styles.name: circleBlur
styles.description: Amount to blur the circle. 1 blurs the circle such that only the centerpoint is full opacity.

styles.name: circleOpacity
styles.description: The opacity at which the circle will be drawn.

styles.name: circleTranslate
styles.description: The geometry's offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively.

styles.name: circleTranslateAnchor

values.doc: The circle is translated relative to the map.
The circle is translated relative to the viewport.

styles.description: Controls the frame of reference for `circleTranslate`.

styles.name: circlePitchScale

values.doc: Circles are scaled according to their apparent distance to the camera.
Circles are not scaled.

styles.description: Controls the scaling behavior of the circle when the map is pitched.

styles.name: circlePitchAlignment

values.doc: The circle is aligned to the plane of the map.
The circle is aligned to the plane of the viewport.

styles.description: Orientation of circle when map is pitched.

styles.name: circleStrokeWidth
styles.description: The width of the circle's stroke. Strokes are placed outside of the `circleRadius`.

styles.name: circleStrokeColor
styles.description: The stroke color of the circle.

styles.name: circleStrokeOpacity
styles.description: The opacity of the circle's stroke.

FillExtrusionLayer.description: FillExtrusionLayer is a style layer that renders one or more 3D extruded polygons on the map.

props.name: style
props.description: Customizable style attributes

props.name: sourceID
props.description: FIX ME NO DESCRIPTION

FillExtrusionLayer.name: FillExtrusionLayer

styles.name: visibility

values.doc: The layer is shown.
The layer is not shown.

styles.description: Whether this layer is displayed.

styles.name: fillExtrusionOpacity
styles.description: The opacity of the entire fill extrusion layer. This is rendered on a perLayer, not perFeature, basis, and dataDriven styling is not available.

styles.name: fillExtrusionColor
styles.description: The base color of the extruded fill. The extrusion's surfaces will be shaded differently based on this color in combination with the root `light` settings. If this color is specified as `rgba` with an alpha component, the alpha component will be ignored; use `fillExtrusionOpacity` to set layer opacity.

styles.name: fillExtrusionTranslate
styles.description: The geometry's offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up (on the flat plane), respectively.

styles.name: fillExtrusionTranslateAnchor

values.doc: The fill extrusion is translated relative to the map.
The fill extrusion is translated relative to the viewport.

styles.description: Controls the frame of reference for `fillExtrusionTranslate`.

styles.name: fillExtrusionPattern
styles.description: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing images on extruded fills. For seamless patterns, image width and height must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, ..., 512). Note that zoomDependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.

styles.name: fillExtrusionHeight
styles.description: The height with which to extrude this layer.

styles.name: fillExtrusionBase
styles.description: The height with which to extrude the base of this layer. Must be less than or equal to `fillExtrusionHeight`.

styles.name: fillExtrusionVerticalGradient
styles.description: Whether to apply a vertical gradient to the sides of a fillExtrusion layer. If true, sides will be shaded slightly darker farther down.

FillLayer.description: FillLayer is a style layer that renders one or more filled (and optionally stroked) polygons on the map.

props.name: style
props.description: Customizable style attributes

props.name: sourceID
props.description: FIX ME NO DESCRIPTION

FillLayer.name: FillLayer

styles.name: fillSortKey
styles.description: Sorts features in ascending order based on this value. Features with a higher sort key will appear above features with a lower sort key.

styles.name: visibility

values.doc: The layer is shown.
The layer is not shown.

styles.description: Whether this layer is displayed.

styles.name: fillAntialias
styles.description: Whether or not the fill should be antialiased.

styles.name: fillOpacity
styles.description: The opacity of the entire fill layer. In contrast to the `fillColor`, this value will also affect the 1px stroke around the fill, if the stroke is used.

styles.name: fillColor
styles.description: The color of the filled part of this layer. This color can be specified as `rgba` with an alpha component and the color's opacity will not affect the opacity of the 1px stroke, if it is used.

styles.name: fillOutlineColor
styles.description: The outline color of the fill. Matches the value of `fillColor` if unspecified.

styles.name: fillTranslate
styles.description: The geometry's offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively.

styles.name: fillTranslateAnchor

values.doc: The fill is translated relative to the map.
The fill is translated relative to the viewport.

styles.description: Controls the frame of reference for `fillTranslate`.

styles.name: fillPattern
styles.description: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing image fills. For seamless patterns, image width and height must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, ..., 512). Note that zoomDependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.

HeatmapLayer.description: HeatmapLayer is a style layer that renders one or more filled circles on the map.

props.name: style
props.description: Customizable style attributes

props.name: sourceID
props.description: FIX ME NO DESCRIPTION

HeatmapLayer.name: HeatmapLayer

styles.name: visibility

values.doc: The layer is shown.
The layer is not shown.

styles.description: Whether this layer is displayed.

styles.name: heatmapRadius
styles.description: Radius of influence of one heatmap point in pixels. Increasing the value makes the heatmap smoother, but less detailed.

styles.name: heatmapWeight
styles.description: A measure of how much an individual point contributes to the heatmap. A value of 10 would be equivalent to having 10 points of weight 1 in the same spot. Especially useful when combined with clustering.

styles.name: heatmapIntensity
styles.description: Similar to `heatmapWeight` but controls the intensity of the heatmap globally. Primarily used for adjusting the heatmap based on zoom level.

styles.name: heatmapColor
styles.description: Defines the color of each pixel based on its density value in a heatmap.  Should be an expression that uses `["heatmapDensity"]` as input.

styles.name: heatmapOpacity
styles.description: The global opacity at which the heatmap layer will be drawn.

ImageSource.description:
ImageSource is a content source that is used for a georeferenced raster image to be shown on the map.
The georeferenced image scales and rotates as the user zooms and rotates the map

props.name: id
props.description: A string that uniquely identifies the source.

props.name: url
props.description:
An HTTP(S) URL, absolute file URL, or local file URL to the source image.
Gifs are currently not supported.

props.name: coordinates
props.description: The top left, top right, bottom right, and bottom left coordinates for the image.

props.name: children
props.description: FIX ME NO DESCRIPTION

ImageSource.name: ImageSource

Images.description: Images defines the images used in Symbol etc layers

props.name: images
props.description:
Specifies the external images in key-value pairs required for the shape source.
Keys are names - see iconImage expressions, values can be either urls-s objects
with format `{uri: 'http://...'}` or `require('image.png')` or `import "image.png"`

props.name: nativeAssetImages
props.description:
If you have an asset under Image.xcassets on iOS and the drawables directory on android
you can specify an array of string names with assets as the key `['pin']`.

props.name: id
props.description: FIX ME NO DESCRIPTION

props.name: children

Images.name: Images

Light.description: Light represents the light source for extruded geometries

props.name: style
props.description: Customizable style attributes

Light.name: Light

styles.name: anchor

values.doc: The position of the light source is aligned to the rotation of the map.
The position of the light source is aligned to the rotation of the viewport.

styles.description: Whether extruded geometries are lit relative to the map or viewport.

styles.name: position
styles.description: Position of the light source relative to lit (extruded) geometries, in [r radial coordinate, a azimuthal angle, p polar angle] where r indicates the distance from the center of the base of an object to its light, a indicates the position of the light relative to 0° (0° when `light.anchor` is set to `viewport` corresponds to the top of the viewport, or 0° when `light.anchor` is set to `map` corresponds to due north, and degrees proceed clockwise), and p indicates the height of the light (from 0°, directly above, to 180°, directly below).

styles.name: color
styles.description: Color tint for lighting extruded geometries.

styles.name: intensity
styles.description: Intensity of lighting (on a scale from 0 to 1). Higher numbers will present as more extreme contrast.

LineLayer.description: LineLayer is a style layer that renders one or more stroked polylines on the map.

props.name: style
props.description: Customizable style attributes

props.name: sourceID
props.description: FIX ME NO DESCRIPTION

LineLayer.name: LineLayer

styles.name: lineCap

values.doc: A cap with a squared-off end which is drawn to the exact endpoint of the line.
A cap with a rounded end which is drawn beyond the endpoint of the line at a radius of one-half of the line's width and centered on the endpoint of the line.
A cap with a squared-off end which is drawn beyond the endpoint of the line at a distance of one-half of the line's width.

styles.description: The display of line endings.

styles.name: lineJoin

values.doc: A join with a squared-off end which is drawn beyond the endpoint of the line at a distance of one-half of the line's width.
A join with a rounded end which is drawn beyond the endpoint of the line at a radius of one-half of the line's width and centered on the endpoint of the line.
A join with a sharp, angled corner which is drawn with the outer sides beyond the endpoint of the path until they meet.

styles.description: The display of lines when joining.

styles.name: lineMiterLimit
styles.description: Used to automatically convert miter joins to bevel joins for sharp angles.

styles.name: lineRoundLimit
styles.description: Used to automatically convert round joins to miter joins for shallow angles.

styles.name: lineSortKey
styles.description: Sorts features in ascending order based on this value. Features with a higher sort key will appear above features with a lower sort key.

styles.name: visibility

values.doc: The layer is shown.
The layer is not shown.

styles.description: Whether this layer is displayed.

styles.name: lineOpacity
styles.description: The opacity at which the line will be drawn.

styles.name: lineColor
styles.description: The color with which the line will be drawn.

styles.name: lineTranslate
styles.description: The geometry's offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively.

styles.name: lineTranslateAnchor

values.doc: The line is translated relative to the map.
The line is translated relative to the viewport.

styles.description: Controls the frame of reference for `lineTranslate`.

styles.name: lineWidth
styles.description: Stroke thickness.

styles.name: lineGapWidth
styles.description: Draws a line casing outside of a line's actual path. Value indicates the width of the inner gap.

styles.name: lineOffset
styles.description: The line's offset. For linear features, a positive value offsets the line to the right, relative to the direction of the line, and a negative value to the left. For polygon features, a positive value results in an inset, and a negative value results in an outset.

styles.name: lineBlur
styles.description: Blur applied to the line, in pixels.

styles.name: lineDasharray
styles.description: Specifies the lengths of the alternating dashes and gaps that form the dash pattern. The lengths are later scaled by the line width. To convert a dash length to pixels, multiply the length by the current line width. Note that GeoJSON sources with `lineMetrics: true` specified won't render dashed lines to the expected scale. Also note that zoomDependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.

styles.name: linePattern
styles.description: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing image lines. For seamless patterns, image width must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, ..., 512). Note that zoomDependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.

styles.name: lineGradient
styles.description: Defines a gradient with which to color a line feature. Can only be used with GeoJSON sources that specify `"lineMetrics": true`.

params.name: filter
params.description: A set of strings that correspond to the names of layers defined in the current style. Only the features contained in these layers are included in the returned array.

params.name: layerIDs

methods.description:
Returns an array of rendered map features that intersect with the given rectangle,

methods.name: showAttribution
methods.docblock:
Show the attribution and telemetry action sheet.
If you implement a custom attribution button, you should add this action to the button.
methods.description:
Show the attribution and telemetry action sheet.
If you implement a custom attribution button, you should add this action to the button.

props.name: contentInset
props.description: The distance from the edges of the map view’s frame to the edges of the map view’s logical viewport.

props.name: style
props.description: Style for wrapping React Native View

props.name: mapStyle
props.description: Style for map - either a URL or a Style JSON (https://maplibre.org/maplibre-style-spec/). Default: `StyleURL.Default`

props.name: preferredFramesPerSecond
props.description:
iOS: The preferred frame rate at which the map view is rendered.
The default value for this property is MLNMapViewPreferredFramesPerSecondDefault,
which will adaptively set the preferred frame rate based on the capability of
the user’s device to maintain a smooth experience. This property can be set to arbitrary integer values.

Android: The maximum frame rate at which the map view is rendered, but it can't excess the ability of device hardware.
This property can be set to arbitrary integer values.

props.name: localizeLabels
props.description:
Automatically change the language of the map labels to the system’s preferred language,
this is not something that can be toggled on/off

props.name: zoomEnabled
props.description: Enable/Disable zoom on the map

props.name: scrollEnabled
props.description: Enable/Disable scroll on the map

props.name: pitchEnabled
props.description: Enable/Disable pitch on map

props.name: rotateEnabled
props.description: Enable/Disable rotation on map

props.name: attributionEnabled
props.description:
Enable/Disable attribution on map.

This must be enabled for Mapbox-hosted tiles and styles. Please refer to the Mapbox Terms of Service.
Other providers do not require this.

props.name: attributionPosition
props.description: Adds attribution offset, e.g. `{top: 8, left: 8}` will put attribution button in top-left corner of the map

props.name: tintColor
props.description: MapView's tintColor

props.name: logoEnabled
props.description: Enable/Disable the logo on the map.

props.name: logoPosition
props.description: Adds logo offset, e.g. `{top: 8, left: 8}` will put the logo in top-left corner of the map

props.name: compassEnabled
props.description: Enable/Disable the compass from appearing on the map

props.name: compassViewPosition
props.description: Change corner of map the compass starts at. 0: TopLeft, 1: TopRight, 2: BottomLeft, 3: BottomRight

props.name: compassViewMargins
props.description: Add margins to the compass with x and y values

props.name: surfaceView
props.description: [Android only] Enable/Disable use of GLSurfaceView insted of TextureView.

props.name: onUserLocationUpdate
props.description:
This event is triggered when the user location is updated.
*signature:*`(location:Location) => void`

props.name: regionWillChangeDebounceTime
props.description: The emitted frequency of regionwillchange events

props.name: regionDidChangeDebounceTime
props.description: The emitted frequency of regiondidchange events

props.name: children
props.description: FIX ME NO DESCRIPTION

MarkerView.description:
MarkerView allows you to place a interactive react native marker to the map.

If you have static view consider using PointAnnotation or SymbolLayer they'll offer much better performance
.
This is based on [MakerView plugin](https://github.com/maplibre/maplibre-plugins-android/tree/main/plugin-markerview) on Android
and PointAnnotation on iOS.

props.name: coordinate
props.description:
The center point (specified as a map coordinate) of the marker.
See also #anchor.

props.name: anchor
props.description:
Specifies the anchor being set on a particular point of the annotation.
The anchor point is specified in the continuous space [0.0, 1.0] x [0.0, 1.0],
where (0, 0) is the top-left corner of the image, and (1, 1) is the bottom-right corner.
Note this is only for custom annotations not the default pin view.
Defaults to the center of the view.

props.name: allowOverlap
props.description: FIX ME NO DESCRIPTION

props.name: isSelected
props.description: FIX ME NO DESCRIPTION

props.name: children
props.description: Expects one child - can be container with multiple elements

MarkerView.name: MarkerView

OfflineManager.name: OfflineManager
OfflineManager.description:
OfflineManager implements a singleton (shared object) that manages offline packs.
All of this class’s instance methods are asynchronous, reflecting the fact that offline resources are stored in a database.
The shared object maintains a canonical collection of offline packs.

methods.name: createPack
methods.description: Creates and registers an offline pack that downloads the resources needed to use the given region offline.

params.name: options
params.description: Create options for a offline pack that specifices zoom levels, style url, and the region to download.

params.name: progressListener
params.description: Callback that listens for status events while downloading the offline resource.

params.name: errorListener
params.description: Callback that listens for status events while downloading the offline resource.

methods.name: invalidatePack
methods.description: Invalidates the specified offline pack. This method checks that the tiles in the specified offline pack match those from the server. Local tiles that do not match the latest version on the server are updated.This is more efficient than deleting the offline pack and downloading it again. If the data stored locally matches that on the server, new data will not be downloaded.

methods.name: deletePack
methods.description: Unregisters the given offline pack and allows resources that are no longer required by any remaining packs to be potentially freed.

methods.name: invalidateAmbientCache
methods.description:
Forces a revalidation of the tiles in the ambient cache and downloads a fresh version of the tiles from the tile server.
This is the recommend method for clearing the cache.
This is the most efficient method because tiles in the ambient cache are re-downloaded to remove outdated data from a device.
It does not erase resources from the ambient cache or delete the database, which can be computationally expensive operations that may carry unintended side effects.

methods.name: clearAmbientCache
methods.description:
Erases resources from the ambient cache.
This method clears the cache and decreases the amount of space that map resources take up on the device.

methods.name: setMaximumAmbientCacheSize
methods.description:
Sets the maximum size of the ambient cache in bytes. Disables the ambient cache if set to 0.
This method may be computationally expensive because it will erase resources from the ambient cache if its size is decreased.

methods.name: resetDatabase
methods.description: Deletes the existing database, which includes both the ambient cache and offline packs, then reinitializes it.

methods.name: getPacks
methods.description: Retrieves all the current offline packs that are stored in the database.

methods.name: getPack
methods.description: Retrieves an offline pack that is stored in the database by name.

methods.name: mergeOfflineRegions
methods.description: Sideloads offline db

params.name: path
params.description: Path to offline tile db on file system.

methods.name: setTileCountLimit
methods.description:
Sets the maximum number of tiles that may be downloaded and stored on the current device.
Consult the Terms of Service for your map tile host before changing this value.

methods.name: setProgressEventThrottle
methods.description:
Sets the period at which download status events will be sent over the React Native bridge.
The default is 500ms.

methods.name: subscribe
methods.description:
Subscribe to download status/error events for the requested offline pack.
Note that createPack calls this internally if listeners are provided.

params.name: progressListener
params.description: Callback that listens for status events while downloading the offline resource.

params.name: errorListener
params.description: Callback that listens for status events while downloading the offline resource.

methods.name: unsubscribe
methods.description:
Unsubscribes any listeners associated with the offline pack.
It's a good idea to call this on componentWillUnmount.

PointAnnotation.description:
PointAnnotation represents a one-dimensional shape located at a single geographical coordinate.

Consider using ShapeSource and SymbolLayer instead, if you have many points, and you have static images,
they'll offer much better performance.

If you need interactive views please use MarkerView,
as with PointAnnotation on Android child views are rendered onto a bitmap for better performance.

methods.name: refresh
methods.docblock:
On android point annotation is rendered offscreen with a canvas into an image.
To rerender the image from the current state of the view call refresh.
Call this for example from Image#onLoad.
methods.description:
On android point annotation is rendered offscreen with a canvas into an image.
To rerender the image from the current state of the view call refresh.
Call this for example from Image#onLoad.

props.name: id
props.description: A string that uniquely identifies the annotation

props.name: title
props.description: The string containing the annotation’s title. Note this is required to be set if you want to see a callout appear on iOS.

props.name: snippet
props.description: The string containing the annotation’s snippet(subtitle). Not displayed in the default callout.

props.name: selected
props.description: Manually selects/deselects annotation

props.name: draggable
props.description: Enable or disable dragging. Defaults to false.

props.name: coordinate
props.description: The center point (specified as a map coordinate) of the annotation.

props.name: anchor
props.description:
Specifies the anchor being set on a particular point of the annotation.
The anchor point is specified in the continuous space [0.0, 1.0] x [0.0, 1.0],
where (0, 0) is the top-left corner of the image, and (1, 1) is the bottom-right corner.
Note this is only for custom annotations not the default pin view.
Defaults to the center of the view.

props.name: children
props.description: Expects one child, and an optional callout can be added as well

props.name: style
props.description: FIX ME NO DESCRIPTION

props.description: FIX ME NO DESCRIPTION

styles.name: visibility

values.doc: The layer is shown.
The layer is not shown.

styles.description: Whether this layer is displayed.

styles.name: rasterOpacity
styles.description: The opacity at which the image will be drawn.

styles.name: rasterHueRotate
styles.description: Rotates hues around the color wheel.

styles.name: rasterBrightnessMin
styles.description: Increase or reduce the brightness of the image. The value is the minimum brightness.

styles.name: rasterBrightnessMax
styles.description: Increase or reduce the brightness of the image. The value is the maximum brightness.

styles.name: rasterSaturation
styles.description: Increase or reduce the saturation of the image.

styles.name: rasterContrast
styles.description: Increase or reduce the contrast of the image.

styles.name: rasterResampling

values.doc: (Bi)linear filtering interpolates pixel values using the weighted average of the four closest original source pixels creating a smooth but blurry look when overscaled
Nearest neighbor filtering interpolates pixel values using the nearest original source pixel creating a sharp but pixelated look when overscaled

styles.description: The resampling/interpolation method to use for overscaling, also known as texture magnification filter

styles.name: rasterFadeDuration
styles.description: Fade duration when a new tile is added, or when a video is started or its coordinates are updated.

RasterSource.description:
RasterSource is a map content source that supplies raster image tiles to be shown on the map.
The location of and metadata about the tiles are defined either by an option dictionary
or by an external file that conforms to the TileJSON specification.

props.name: id
props.description: A string that uniquely identifies the source.

props.name: url
props.description: A URL to a TileJSON configuration file describing the source’s contents and other metadata.

props.name: tileUrlTemplates
props.description:
An array of tile URL templates. If multiple endpoints are specified, clients may use any combination of endpoints.
Example: https://example.com/raster-tiles/{z}/{x}/{y}.png

props.name: minZoomLevel
props.description:
An unsigned integer that specifies the minimum zoom level at which to display tiles from the source.
The value should be between 0 and 22, inclusive, and less than
maxZoomLevel, if specified. The default value for this option is 0.

props.name: maxZoomLevel
props.description:
An unsigned integer that specifies the maximum zoom level at which to display tiles from the source.
The value should be between 0 and 22, inclusive, and less than
minZoomLevel, if specified. The default value for this option is 22.

props.name: tileSize
props.description:
Size of the map tiles.
Mapbox urls default to 256, all others default to 512.

props.name: tms
props.description: Influences the y direction of the tile coordinates. (tms inverts y axis)

props.name: attribution
props.description:
An HTML or literal text string defining the buttons to be displayed in an action sheet when the
source is part of a map view’s style and the map view’s attribution button is pressed.

props.name: children
props.description: FIX ME NO DESCRIPTION

RasterSource.name: RasterSource

ShapeSource.description:
ShapeSource is a map content source that supplies vector shapes to be shown on the map.
The shape may be a url or a GeoJSON object

methods.name: features

params.name: filter
params.description: an optional filter statement to filter the returned Features.

methods.description:
Returns all features from the source that match the query parameters regardless of whether or not the feature is
currently rendered on the map.

methods.name: getClusterExpansionZoom
methods.description: Returns the zoom needed to expand the cluster.

methods.name: getClusterLeaves

params.name: limit
params.description: The number of points to return.

params.name: offset
params.description: The amount of points to skip (for pagination).

methods.description: Returns the FeatureCollection from the cluster.
examples: const collection = await shapeSource.getClusterLeaves(clusterId, limit, offset);

methods.name: getClusterChildren
methods.description: Returns the FeatureCollection from the cluster (on the next zoom level).

props.name: id
props.description: A string that uniquely identifies the source.

props.name: url
props.description: An HTTP(S) URL, absolute file URL, or local file URL relative to the current application’s resource bundle.

props.name: shape
props.description: The contents of the source. A shape can represent a GeoJSON geometry, a feature, or a feature colllection.

props.name: cluster
props.description: Enables clustering on the source for point shapes.

props.name: clusterRadius
props.description:
Specifies the radius of each cluster if clustering is enabled.
A value of 512 produces a radius equal to the width of a tile.
The default value is 50.

props.name: clusterMaxZoomLevel
props.description:
Specifies the maximum zoom level at which to cluster points if clustering is enabled.
Defaults to one zoom level less than the value of maxZoomLevel so that, at the maximum zoom level,
the shapes are not clustered.

props.name: clusterProperties
props.description:
Specifies custom properties on the generated clusters if clustering
is enabled, aggregating values from clustered points.

Has the form `{ "property_name": [operator, map_expression]}`, where
 `operator` is a custom reduce expression that references a special `["accumulated"]` value -
  it accumulates the property value from clusters/points the cluster contains
 `map_expression` produces the value of a single point

@example `{ "resultingSum": [["+", ["accumulated"], ["get", "resultingSum"]], ["get", "scalerank"]] }`

props.name: maxZoomLevel
props.description:
Specifies the maximum zoom level at which to create vector tiles.
A greater value produces greater detail at high zoom levels.
The default value is 18.

props.name: buffer
props.description:
Specifies the size of the tile buffer on each side.
A value of 0 produces no buffer. A value of 512 produces a buffer as wide as the tile itself.
Larger values produce fewer rendering artifacts near tile edges and slower performance.
The default value is 128.

props.name: tolerance
props.description:
Specifies the Douglas-Peucker simplification tolerance.
A greater value produces simpler geometries and improves performance.
The default value is 0.375.

props.name: lineMetrics
props.description:
Whether to calculate line distance metrics.
This is required for line layers that specify lineGradient values.
The default value is false.

props.name: onPress
props.description:
Source press listener, gets called when a user presses one of the children layers only if that layer has a higher z-index than another source layers.
*signature:*`(event:OnPressEvent) => void`

props.name: hitbox
props.description: Overrides the default touch hitbox (44x44 pixels) for the source layers

props.name: children
props.description: FIX ME NO DESCRIPTION

ShapeSource.name: ShapeSource

SnapshotManager.name: SnapshotManager
SnapshotManager.description:
The SnapshotManager generates static raster images of the map.
Each snapshot image depicts a portion of a map defined by an SnapshotOptions object you provide.
The snapshotter generates the snapshot asynchronous.

methods.name: takeSnap
methods.description: Takes a snapshot of the base map using the provided Snapshot options. NOTE pitch, heading, zoomLevel only works when centerCoordinate is set!

params.name: options
params.description: Snapshot options for create a static image of the base map

SymbolLayer.description: SymbolLayer is a style layer that renders icon and text labels at points or along lines on the map.

props.name: style
props.description: Customizable style attributes

props.name: sourceID
props.description: FIX ME NO DESCRIPTION

SymbolLayer.name: SymbolLayer

styles.name: symbolPlacement

values.doc: The label is placed at the point where the geometry is located.
The label is placed along the line of the geometry. Can only be used on `LineString` and `Polygon` geometries.

The label is placed at the center of the line of the geometry. Can only be used on `LineString` and `Polygon` geometries. Note that a single feature in a vector tile may contain multiple line geometries.

styles.description: Label placement relative to its geometry.

styles.name: symbolSpacing
styles.description: Distance between two symbol anchors.

styles.name: symbolAvoidEdges
styles.description: If true, the symbols will not cross tile edges to avoid mutual collisions. Recommended in layers that don't have enough padding in the vector tile to prevent collisions, or if it is a point symbol layer placed after a line symbol layer. When using a client that supports global collision detection, like MapLibre GL JS version 0.42.0 or greater, enabling this property is not needed to prevent clipped labels at tile boundaries.

styles.name: symbolSortKey
styles.description: Sorts features in ascending order based on this value. Features with lower sort keys are drawn and placed first.  When `iconAllowOverlap` or `textAllowOverlap` is `false`, features with a lower sort key will have priority during placement. When `iconAllowOverlap` or `textAllowOverlap` is set to `true`, features with a higher sort key will overlap over features with a lower sort key.

styles.name: symbolZOrder

values.doc: Sorts symbols by `symbol-sort-key` if set. Otherwise, sorts symbols by their y-position relative to the viewport if `icon-allow-overlap` or `text-allow-overlap` is set to `true` or `icon-ignore-placement` or `text-ignore-placement` is `false`.
Sorts symbols by their y-position relative to the viewport if `icon-allow-overlap` or `text-allow-overlap` is set to `true` or `icon-ignore-placement` or `text-ignore-placement` is `false`.
Sorts symbols by `symbol-sort-key` if set. Otherwise, no sorting is applied; symbols are rendered in the same order as the source data.

styles.description: Determines whether overlapping symbols in the same layer are rendered in the order that they appear in the data source or by their yPosition relative to the viewport. To control the order and prioritization of symbols otherwise, use `symbolSortKey`.

styles.name: iconAllowOverlap
styles.description: If true, the icon will be visible even if it collides with other previously drawn symbols.

styles.name: iconIgnorePlacement
styles.description: If true, other symbols can be visible even if they collide with the icon.

styles.name: iconOptional
styles.description: If true, text will display without their corresponding icons when the icon collides with other symbols and the text does not.

styles.name: iconRotationAlignment

values.doc: When `symbol-placement` is set to `point`, aligns icons east-west. When `symbol-placement` is set to `line` or `line-center`, aligns icon x-axes with the line.
Produces icons whose x-axes are aligned with the x-axis of the viewport, regardless of the value of `symbol-placement`.
When `symbol-placement` is set to `point`, this is equivalent to `viewport`. When `symbol-placement` is set to `line` or `line-center`, this is equivalent to `map`.

styles.description: In combination with `symbolPlacement`, determines the rotation behavior of icons.

styles.name: iconSize
styles.units: factor of the original icon size
styles.description: Scales the original size of the icon by the provided factor. The new pixel size of the image will be the original pixel size multiplied by `iconSize`. 1 is the original size; 3 triples the size of the image.

styles.name: iconTextFit

values.doc: The icon is displayed at its intrinsic aspect ratio.
The icon is scaled in the x-dimension to fit the width of the text.
The icon is scaled in the y-dimension to fit the height of the text.
The icon is scaled in both x- and y-dimensions.

styles.description: Scales the icon to fit around the associated text.

styles.name: iconTextFitPadding
styles.description: Size of the additional area added to dimensions determined by `iconTextFit`, in clockwise order: top, right, bottom, left.

styles.name: iconImage
styles.description: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing an image background.

styles.name: iconRotate
styles.description: Rotates the icon clockwise.

styles.name: iconPadding
styles.description: Size of additional area round the icon bounding box used for detecting symbol collisions.

styles.name: iconKeepUpright
styles.description: If true, the icon may be flipped to prevent it from being rendered upsideDown.

styles.name: iconOffset
styles.description: Offset distance of icon from its anchor. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up. Each component is multiplied by the value of `iconSize` to obtain the final offset in pixels. When combined with `iconRotate` the offset will be as if the rotated direction was up.

styles.name: iconAnchor

values.doc: The center of the icon is placed closest to the anchor.
The left side of the icon is placed closest to the anchor.
The right side of the icon is placed closest to the anchor.
The top of the icon is placed closest to the anchor.
The bottom of the icon is placed closest to the anchor.
The top left corner of the icon is placed closest to the anchor.
The top right corner of the icon is placed closest to the anchor.
The bottom left corner of the icon is placed closest to the anchor.
The bottom right corner of the icon is placed closest to the anchor.

styles.description: Part of the icon placed closest to the anchor.

styles.name: iconPitchAlignment

values.doc: The icon is aligned to the plane of the map.
The icon is aligned to the plane of the viewport.
Automatically matches the value of `icon-rotation-alignment`.

styles.description: Orientation of icon when map is pitched.

styles.name: textPitchAlignment

values.doc: The text is aligned to the plane of the map.
The text is aligned to the plane of the viewport.
Automatically matches the value of `text-rotation-alignment`.

styles.description: Orientation of text when map is pitched.

styles.name: textRotationAlignment

values.doc: When `symbol-placement` is set to `point`, aligns text east-west. When `symbol-placement` is set to `line` or `line-center`, aligns text x-axes with the line.
Produces glyphs whose x-axes are aligned with the x-axis of the viewport, regardless of the value of `symbol-placement`.

When `symbol-placement` is set to `point`, aligns text to the x-axis of the viewport. When `symbol-placement` is set to `line` or `line-center`, aligns glyphs to the x-axis of the viewport and places them along the line.
When `symbol-placement` is set to `point`, this is equivalent to `viewport`. When `symbol-placement` is set to `line` or `line-center`, this is equivalent to `map`.

styles.description: In combination with `symbolPlacement`, determines the rotation behavior of the individual glyphs forming the text.

styles.name: textField
styles.description: Value to use for a text label. If a plain `string` is provided, it will be treated as a `formatted` with default/inherited formatting options.

styles.name: textFont
styles.description: Font stack to use for displaying text.

styles.name: textSize
styles.description: Font size.

styles.name: textMaxWidth
styles.description: The maximum line width for text wrapping.

styles.name: textLineHeight
styles.description: Text leading value for multiLine text.

styles.name: textLetterSpacing
styles.description: Text tracking amount.

styles.name: textJustify

values.doc: The text is aligned towards the anchor position.
The text is aligned to the left.
The text is centered.
The text is aligned to the right.

styles.description: Text justification options.

styles.name: textRadialOffset
styles.description: Radial offset of text, in the direction of the symbol's anchor. Useful in combination with `textVariableAnchor`, which defaults to using the twoDimensional `textOffset` if present.

styles.name: textVariableAnchor
styles.description: To increase the chance of placing highPriority labels on the map, you can provide an array of `textAnchor` locations: the renderer will attempt to place the label at each location, in order, before moving onto the next label. Use `textJustify: auto` to choose justification based on anchor position. To apply an offset, use the `textRadialOffset` or the twoDimensional `textOffset`.

styles.name: textAnchor

values.doc: The center of the text is placed closest to the anchor.
The left side of the text is placed closest to the anchor.
The right side of the text is placed closest to the anchor.
The top of the text is placed closest to the anchor.
The bottom of the text is placed closest to the anchor.
The top left corner of the text is placed closest to the anchor.
The top right corner of the text is placed closest to the anchor.
The bottom left corner of the text is placed closest to the anchor.
The bottom right corner of the text is placed closest to the anchor.

styles.description: Part of the text placed closest to the anchor.

styles.name: textMaxAngle
styles.description: Maximum angle change between adjacent characters.

styles.name: textWritingMode
styles.description: The property allows control over a symbol's orientation. Note that the property values act as a hint, so that a symbol whose language doesn’t support the provided orientation will be laid out in its natural orientation. Example: English point symbol will be rendered horizontally even if array value contains single 'vertical' enum value. The order of elements in an array define priority order for the placement of an orientation variant.

styles.name: textRotate
styles.description: Rotates the text clockwise.

styles.name: textPadding
styles.description: Size of the additional area around the text bounding box used for detecting symbol collisions.

styles.name: textKeepUpright
styles.description: If true, the text may be flipped vertically to prevent it from being rendered upsideDown.

styles.name: textTransform

values.doc: The text is not altered.
Forces all letters to be displayed in uppercase.
Forces all letters to be displayed in lowercase.

styles.description: Specifies how to capitalize text, similar to the CSS `textTransform` property.

styles.name: textOffset
styles.description: Offset distance of text from its anchor. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up. If used with textVariableAnchor, input values will be taken as absolute values. Offsets along the x and yAxis will be applied automatically based on the anchor position.

styles.name: textAllowOverlap
styles.description: If true, the text will be visible even if it collides with other previously drawn symbols.

styles.name: textIgnorePlacement
styles.description: If true, other symbols can be visible even if they collide with the text.

styles.name: textOptional
styles.description: If true, icons will display without their corresponding text when the text collides with other symbols and the icon does not.

styles.name: visibility

values.doc: The layer is shown.
The layer is not shown.

styles.description: Whether this layer is displayed.

styles.name: iconOpacity
styles.description: The opacity at which the icon will be drawn.

styles.name: iconColor
styles.description: The color of the icon. This can only be used with SDF icons.

styles.name: iconHaloColor
styles.description: The color of the icon's halo. Icon halos can only be used with SDF icons.

styles.name: iconHaloWidth
styles.description:
Distance of halo to the icon outline. 

The unit is in pixels only for SDF sprites that were created with a blur radius of 8, multiplied by the display density. I.e., the radius needs to be 16 for `@2x` sprites, etc.

styles.name: iconHaloBlur
styles.description: Fade out the halo towards the outside.

styles.name: iconTranslate
styles.description: Distance that the icon's anchor is moved from its original placement. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up.

styles.name: iconTranslateAnchor

values.doc: Icons are translated relative to the map.
Icons are translated relative to the viewport.

styles.description: Controls the frame of reference for `iconTranslate`.

styles.name: textOpacity
styles.description: The opacity at which the text will be drawn.

styles.name: textColor
styles.description: The color with which the text will be drawn.

styles.name: textHaloColor
styles.description: The color of the text's halo, which helps it stand out from backgrounds.

styles.name: textHaloWidth
styles.description: Distance of halo to the font outline. Max text halo width is 1/4 of the fontSize.

styles.name: textHaloBlur
styles.description: The halo's fadeout distance towards the outside.

styles.name: textTranslate
styles.description: Distance that the text's anchor is moved from its original placement. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up.

styles.name: textTranslateAnchor

values.doc: The text is translated relative to the map.
The text is translated relative to the viewport.

styles.description: Controls the frame of reference for `textTranslate`.

methods.name: setLocationManager
methods.description:
Whether to start or stop listening to the LocationManager

Notice, that listening will start automatically when
either `onUpdate` or `visible` are set

methods.name: needsLocationManagerRunning
methods.docblock:
If LocationManager should be running

@return {boolean}
methods.description: If LocationManager should be running

props.name: animated
props.description: Whether location icon is animated between updates

props.name: renderMode
props.description:
Which render mode to use.
Can either be `normal` or `native`

props.name: androidRenderMode
props.description:
native/android only render mode

 - normal: just a circle
 - compass: triangle with heading
 - gps: large arrow

@platform android

props.name: visible
props.description: Whether location icon is visible

props.name: showsUserHeadingIndicator
props.description: Show or hide small arrow which indicates direction the device is pointing relative to north.

props.name: minDisplacement
props.description: Minimum amount of movement before GPS location is updated in meters

props.name: androidPreferredFramesPerSecond
props.description:
Android only. Set max FPS at which location animators can output updates. Use this setting to limit animation rate of the location puck on higher zoom levels to decrease the stress on the device's CPU which can directly improve battery life, without sacrificing UX.

@platform android

props.name: children
props.description:
Custom location icon of type mapbox-gl-native components

NOTE: Forking maintainer does not understand the above comment.

VectorSource.description:
VectorSource is a map content source that supplies tiled vector data in Mapbox Vector Tile format to be shown on the map.
The location of and metadata about the tiles are defined either by an option dictionary or by an external file that conforms to the TileJSON specification.

methods.name: features

params.name: layerIDs
params.description: A set of strings that correspond to the names of layers defined in the current style. Only the features contained in these layers are included in the returned array.

params.name: filter
params.description: an optional filter statement to filter the returned Features.

methods.description:
Returns all features that match the query parameters regardless of whether or not the feature is
currently rendered on the map. The domain of the query includes all currently-loaded vector tiles
and GeoJSON source tiles. This function does not check tiles outside of the visible viewport.

props.name: id
props.description: A string that uniquely identifies the source.

props.name: url
props.description: A URL to a TileJSON configuration file describing the source’s contents and other metadata.

props.name: tileUrlTemplates
props.description:
An array of tile URL templates. If multiple endpoints are specified, clients may use any combination of endpoints.
Example: https://example.com/vector-tiles/{z}/{x}/{y}.pbf

props.name: minZoomLevel
props.description:
An unsigned integer that specifies the minimum zoom level at which to display tiles from the source.
The value should be between 0 and 22, inclusive, and less than
maxZoomLevel, if specified. The default value for this option is 0.

props.name: maxZoomLevel
props.description:
An unsigned integer that specifies the maximum zoom level at which to display tiles from the source.
The value should be between 0 and 22, inclusive, and less than
minZoomLevel, if specified. The default value for this option is 22.

props.name: tms
props.description: Influences the y direction of the tile coordinates. (tms inverts y axis)

props.name: attribution
props.description:
An HTML or literal text string defining the buttons to be displayed in an action sheet when the
source is part of a map view’s style and the map view’s attribution button is pressed.

props.name: onPress
props.description:
Source press listener, gets called when a user presses one of the children layers only
if that layer has a higher z-index than another source layers
*signature:*`(event:OnPressEvent) => void`

props.name: hitbox
props.description: Overrides the default touch hitbox(44x44 pixels) for the source layers

props.name: children
props.description: FIX ME NO DESCRIPTION

VectorSource.name: VectorSource
